marketNews.title: Trump Announces Reciprocal Tariff, China Responds
marketNews.content: U.S. President Donald Trump announced on 2 April 2025 a reciprocal tariff policy with a minimum rate of 10% on all imports into the United States. In addition, higher tariffs will be applied to 57 countries that are the sources of the U.S. trade deficit. The minimum 10% reciprocal tariff will take effect on 5 April 2025, while the higher tariffs for the 57 countries will start on 9 April 2025. The reciprocal tariff is added on top of any existing import duties. For example, the total tariff on China as of 9 April 2025 will be 54%, consisting of a 34% reciprocal tariff plus an existing 20% duty. Mexico and Canada are exempt from the reciprocal tariff. Certain commodities are also exempt, including semiconductors, copper, medical goods and pharmaceuticals. Two days later, on 4 April 2025, China announced it would impose an additional 34% tariff on all U.S. products, effective 10 April 2025, and would restrict rare-earth exports to the United States starting 4 April 2025. In response, President Trump warned that the United States would impose an additional 50% tariff on China if Beijing does not cancel its reciprocal measures. The Chinese Ministry of Commerce said it would fight to the end to protect national interests. The European Union has also proposed a 25% counter-tariff on certain U.S. imports, scheduled to take effect on 16 May 2025. The Indonesian government said it will not take retaliatory steps and will pursue diplomatic negotiations. Indonesia will send a delegation, including Finance Minister Sri Mulyani, to trade talks in the United States next week. The United States is Indonesia’s second-largest export destination after China, with exports worth USD 26.3 billion in 2024 (about 10 % of total exports and roughly 2 % of Indonesia’s GDP). The top five U.S. imports from Indonesia in 2024 were: 1) electrical machinery and equipment (e.g., cables and modems); 2) apparel and accessories (knit and non-knit); 3) footwear; 4) animal and vegetable oils (e.g., palm oil); and 5) rubber and rubber products (e.g., tires). On Tuesday, 8 April, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 7.9 %, the 10-year Indonesian government bond yield rose about 8 basis points to 7.08 %, and the rupiah weakened 1.9 % to IDR 16,865 per USD, marking a historic low. From 2-7 April 2025, the S&P 500 dropped 10.7 %, the Nasdaq fell 11.4 % and the EIDO fell 7.2 %. Asian markets also declined from 2-8 April: the Nikkei 225 fell 7.6 %, the Shanghai Composite fell 6.1 % and the Hang Seng Index fell 13.3 %.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Consumer Price Index March 2025
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Central Statistics Agency (BPS) reported that the consumer price index (CPI) inflation in March 2025 was 1.03 % year-on-year, up from a deflation of 0.09 % in February 2025, but still below the consensus forecast of 1.16 % YoY. This represents the highest annual inflation since December 2024. On a month-to-month basis, CPI inflation was 1.65 % in March, compared with a deflation of 0.48 % in February, also below the consensus estimate of 1.79 % MoM, but the highest level since December 2014 following the end of the electricity tariff discount in February 2025. Core inflation remained at 2.48 % YoY, unchanged from February 2025 and the highest in the past 20 months, though slightly below the consensus estimate of 2.5 % YoY.

marketNews.title: IDX Adjusts Auto-Rejection Limits
marketNews.content: The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) announced on Tuesday, 8 April 2025 a change to the maximum auto-rejection floor, setting it at –15 % for main board, development board, new economy board, exchange-traded funds (ETF) and real-estate investment funds (DIRE) across all price ranges. In addition, BEI revised the trading-halt activation thresholds to –8 % for a 30-minute halt, –15 % for a subsequent 30-minute halt, and –20 % for a halt that lasts until the end of the trading session or longer. The new rules are effective from 8 April 2025.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Manufacturing PMI March 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global reported that Indonesia's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) fell to 52.4 in March 2025, down from 53.6 in February 2025, indicating expansion for the fourth consecutive month. Business confidence remained stable near a 35-month high recorded in February 2025, supported by optimism over new product launches and continued economic improvement.

marketNews.title: China Manufacturing PMI March 2025
marketNews.content: S&P Global reported that China's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 51.2 in March 2025, up from 50.8 in February 2025, surpassing the consensus estimate of 51.1 and reaching the highest level since November 2024 as output increased amid improving demand. However, industry confidence weakened due to rising uncertainty, especially related to the ongoing trade war.

marketNews.title: US Services PMI March 2025
marketNews.content: The Institute for Supply Management (ISM) reported that the U.S. services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) dropped sharply to 50.8 in March 2025, down from 53.5 in February 2025, well below the consensus forecast of 53 and marking the weakest expansion in the services sector since June 2024. ISM noted a significant increase in the number of respondents reporting higher costs due to import tariffs.

marketNews.title: US Non-Farm Payrolls March 2025
marketNews.content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that the U.S. economy added 228,000 non-farm jobs in March 2025, up from 117,000 in February 2025, exceeding the consensus estimate of 135,000 and marking the highest increase in three months.

marketNews.title: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper 2024 Results
marketNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (ticker INKP) reported a net profit of USD 424 million (+3 % YoY) for 2024, supported by a foreign-exchange gain of USD 78 million (2023 recorded a FX loss of USD 25 million). Operating profit for the year was USD 653 million, down 17 % YoY, with an operating margin that fell 220 basis points YoY to 20.4 % due to a 12 % YoY increase in selling expenses.

marketNews.title: Tjiwi Kimia 2024 Results
marketNews.content: Tjiwi Kimia (ticker TKIM) posted a net profit of USD 297 million (+73 % YoY) for 2024, driven by a 45 % YoY gain from its joint venture OKI Pulp and a foreign-exchange gain of USD 28 million (2023 recorded a FX loss of USD 12 million). Operating profit reached USD 69 million, up 9 % YoY, with an operating margin that improved by 110 basis points YoY to 7 %.

marketNews.title: Alam Sutera Realty 2024 Results
marketNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty (ticker ASRI) reported a net profit of IDR 43 billion in Q4 2024, compared with a net profit of IDR 422 billion in Q4 2023 and a Q4 2024 loss of IDR 6 billion in Q4 2023. The full-year 2024 net profit amounted to IDR 213 billion, down 63 % YoY. The decline was caused by a 53 % YoY drop in revenue recognition for the 'Housing and Shophouse' segment, partially offset by a 249 % QoQ increase, leading to an overall 19 % YoY decline in revenue recognition for that segment during 2024.

marketNews.title: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Buyback Plan
marketNews.content: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (ticker CMNP) announced a share buyback program of up to approximately 543.7 million shares (about 10 % of its capital) with a funding allocation of up to IDR 815.6 billion, to be executed between 2 May and 26 June 2025. The corporate action does not require shareholder approval due to the OJK-granted relaxation aimed at supporting market stability.

marketNews.title: Fore Coffee IPO Announcement
marketNews.content: Fore Coffee Indonesia (ticker FORE) set its initial public offering price at IDR 188 per share for 1.88 billion shares (21.08 % of the new issue), targeting proceeds of approximately IDR 353.4 billion. The funds will be allocated 76 % to open about 140 new outlets, 18 % to open new outlets of its subsidiaries, and 6 % for working capital. The IPO is scheduled for 8-10 April 2025, with listing on 14 April 2025. For the nine months ended 2024, FORE reported a net profit of IDR 42 billion (a turnaround from a loss in the same period of 2023), revenue of IDR 727 billion (+135 % YoY) and same-store sales growth of +42 % YoY. The total number of outlets reached 217 as of the nine-month period, up 47 % YoY.

tickerNews.title: PTBA 2024 Net Profit Declines 16.4% YoY, Beats Estimates
tickerNews.content: PT Bukit Asam (ticker PTBA) recorded a net profit of IDR 1.9 trillion in Q4 2024 (+56.4 % QoQ, –19.5 % YoY). This resulted in a full-year 2024 net profit of IDR 5.1 trillion (-16.4 % YoY), surpassing expectations at 115 %/113 % of the 2024F estimate from Stockbit/consensus. Quarterly profit growth was driven by a 10 % QoQ increase in revenue and a 140-basis-point QoQ rise in gross margin, supported by a 3.6 % QoQ increase in sales volume and a 5.3 % QoQ rise in average selling price. Additional contributors were a 215.1 % QoQ jump in income from associations and joint ventures and a 34.9 % QoQ reduction in tax expense. For 2025, management targets a production volume of 50.05 million tons (+15.6 % YoY from 2024), a sales volume of 50.09 million tons (+16.8 % YoY), and a stripping ratio of 6.49× (2024 actual 6.2×).

tickerNews.title: Gudang Garam Reports Net Loss 11 Billion Rupiah in Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Gudang Garam (ticker GGRM) posted a net loss of IDR 11 billion in Q4 2024 (compared with a net profit of IDR 867 billion in Q4 2023 and a net profit of IDR 67 billion in Q3 2024). Consequently, the full-year 2024 net profit was IDR 981 billion (-81.6 % YoY), below the consensus estimate of a 30.9 % profit. The decline was driven by lower revenue and higher operating expenses. Revenue fell to IDR 24.8 trillion (-33.4 % YoY, +3.7 % QoQ), while operating expenses rose to IDR 2 trillion (+5.3 % YoY, –1.7 % QoQ), resulting in an operating margin of only 0.3 % in Q4 2024 (versus 3.3 % in Q4 2023 and 0.9 % in Q3 2024).

tickerNews.title: Semen Indonesia Net Profit 40 Million Rupiah Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Semen Indonesia (ticker SMGR) recorded a net profit of IDR 40 million in Q4 2024 (versus IDR 457 billion in Q4 2023 and IDR 218 billion in Q3 2024). The full-year 2024 net profit amounted to IDR 720 billion (-66.8 % YoY), missing the consensus estimate of a 57.7 % profit. The shortfall was caused by lower revenue and a decline in gross profit margin. Revenue for the year was IDR 9.9 trillion (-10 % YoY, +0.1 % QoQ), while the gross profit margin fell to 19.4 % in Q4 2024 (down from 24.9 % in Q4 2023 and 21.8 % in Q3 2024).

tickerNews.title: TPIA Announces Joint Venture Acquisition of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore for $254 Million
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Petrochemical (ticker TPIA) announced that its joint venture with Glencore plc and CAPGC Pte. Ltd. has completed an agreement to acquire the entire ownership of Shell Energy and Chemicals Park Singapore for USD 254 million (approximately IDR 4.2 trillion at an exchange rate of IDR 16,500 per USD). The asset has been renamed Aster Chemicals and Energy Pte. Ltd. (Aster). Management stated that revenue and profit from the asset will start to be reflected in the financial statements from Q3 2025. TPIA also disclosed that it will contribute capital in proportion to its participation amounting to USD 587 million to Aster for development activities, including the purchase of additional equipment to rejuvenate the asset.

tickerNews.title: Ciputra Development Net Profit 849 Billion Rupiah Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Ciputra Development (ticker CTRA) posted a net profit of IDR 849 billion in Q4 2024 (versus IDR 665 billion in Q4 2023 and IDR 248 billion in Q3 2024). The full-year 2024 net profit reached IDR 2.1 trillion (+15 % YoY), beating the consensus estimate at 104 % of the 2024F forecast. Quarterly profit growth was driven by a strong increase in revenue (+53 % YoY, +96 % QoQ), especially in the Real Estate segment (+72 % YoY, +135 % QoQ). Gross profit margin was pressured, falling by 890 basis points YoY and 160 basis points QoQ, mainly due to a high-base effect in Q4 2023.

tickerNews.title: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Net Profit 318 Billion Rupiah Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ticker ACES) recorded a net profit of IDR 318 billion in Q4 2024 (+12 % YoY, +52 % QoQ). The full-year 2024 net profit was IDR 892 billion (+16 % YoY), surpassing the consensus estimate at 104 % of the 2024F forecast. Revenue grew 11 % YoY and 12 % QoQ in Q4 2024, leading to a full-year revenue increase of 13 % YoY, in line with the consensus estimate of 100 % of the 2024F forecast. Quarterly profit growth was mainly driven by an expansion of gross profit margin (+469 basis points QoQ) and operating profit margin (+104 basis points QoQ). Over 2024, gross profit margin and operating profit margin remained relatively stable at 48.7 % (+5 basis points YoY) and 13.6 % (+38 basis points YoY), respectively, resulting in an operating profit growth of 16 % YoY, above the consensus estimate of 112 % of the 2024F forecast.

tickerNews.title: Arwana Citramulia Announces 2024 Dividend and 2025 Interim Dividend
tickerNews.content: Arwana Citramulia (ticker ARNA) shareholders approved a 2024 dividend of IDR 43 per share, representing a dividend payout ratio of 72.6 % and an implied dividend yield of 6.9 % as of Tuesday, 8 April. In the same public expose, management also announced approval of an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025, to be paid after the 1H 2025 financial statements. Additionally, ARNA set a target for 2025 net profit growth of +10 % YoY, revenue growth of +19 % YoY, and sales volume growth of +11 % YoY.

tickerNews.title: Total Bangun Persada Records New Contract Value 1.23 Trillion Rupiah in 2M25
tickerNews.content: Total Bangun Persada (ticker TOTL) reported a new contract value of IDR 1.23 trillion during the first two months of 2025, representing 24.6 % of its 2025 target of IDR 5 trillion. The contracts comprise projects for public facilities, industrial buildings, and data centers, though further details were not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: Malindo Feedmill Net Profit 129 Billion Rupiah Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Malindo Feedmill (ticker MAIN) posted a net profit of IDR 129 billion in Q4 2024 (+92 % QoQ, +633 % YoY), bringing the full-year 2024 net profit to IDR 488 billion (+670 % YoY). The Q4 profit surge was mainly driven by improvements in the 'DOC' and 'Broiler' segments, each achieving the highest quarterly operating profit since Q2 2018, as well as continued strength in the 'Feed' segment. Throughout 2024, net profit was boosted by higher operating profit margins in the DOC and Broiler segments, with DOC turning from a loss in 2023 to profit, and Broiler reducing its loss to IDR 45 billion (versus a loss of IDR 218 billion in 2023).

tickerNews.title: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper Net Profit $424 Million (3% YoY) 2024
tickerNews.content: Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper (ticker INKP) reported a net profit of USD 424 million (+3 % YoY) for 2024, supported by a foreign-exchange gain of USD 78 million (2023 recorded a FX loss of USD 25 million). Operating profit for the year was USD 653 million, down 17 % YoY, with an operating margin that fell 220 basis points YoY to 20.4 % due to a 12 % YoY increase in selling expenses.

tickerNews.title: Tjiwi Kimia Net Profit $297 Million (73% YoY) 2024
tickerNews.content: Tjiwi Kimia (ticker TKIM) posted a net profit of USD 297 million (+73 % YoY) for 2024, driven by a 45 % YoY gain from its joint venture OKI Pulp and a foreign-exchange gain of USD 28 million (2023 recorded a FX loss of USD 12 million). Operating profit reached USD 69 million, up 9 % YoY, with an operating margin that improved by 110 basis points YoY to 7 %.

tickerNews.title: Alam Sutera Realty Net Profit 43 Billion Rupiah Q4 2024
tickerNews.content: Alam Sutera Realty (ticker ASRI) reported a net profit of IDR 43 billion in Q4 2024 (versus IDR 422 billion in Q4 2023 and a Q4 2024 loss of IDR 6 billion in Q4 2023). The full-year 2024 net profit amounted to IDR 213 billion (-63 % YoY). The annual decline was caused by a 53 % YoY drop in revenue recognition for the 'Housing and Shophouse' segment, partially offset by a 249 % QoQ increase, leading to an overall 19 % YoY decline in revenue recognition for that segment during 2024.

tickerNews.title: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Announces Share Buyback up to 543.7 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada (ticker CMNP) announced a share buyback program of up to approximately 543.7 million shares (about 10 % of its capital) with a funding allocation of up to IDR 815.6 billion, to be executed between 2 May and 26 June 2025. The corporate action does not require shareholder approval due to the OJK-granted relaxation aimed at supporting market stability.

tickerNews.title: Fore Coffee Sets IPO Price 188 Rupiah per Share
tickerNews.content: Fore Coffee Indonesia (ticker FORE) set its initial public offering price at IDR 188 per share for 1.88 billion shares (21.08 % of the new issue), targeting proceeds of approximately IDR 353.4 billion. The funds will be allocated 76 % to open about 140 new outlets, 18 % to open new outlets of its subsidiaries, and 6 % for working capital. The IPO is scheduled for 8-10 April 2025, with listing on 14 April 2025. For the nine months ended 2024, FORE reported a net profit of IDR 42 billion (a turnaround from a loss in the same period of 2023), revenue of IDR 727 billion (+135 % YoY) and same-store sales growth of +42 % YoY. The total number of outlets reached 217 as of the nine-month period, up 47 % YoY.
